name: Bengaluru fort heritage walk.
description: Discover the history of the Bengaluru fort on this walk. The Fort though today reduced to a mere fraction of its original expanse—less than 5%—remains one of the most significant remnants of the city’s pre-colonial past. This heritage walk invites you to step into the vestiges of a fort that once bore witness to battles transitions of power architectural ingenuity and political resilience.The fort began as a modest mud structure before being fortified with stone during Hyder Ali’s rule and later expanded under his son Tipu Sultan. These walls though weathered by time preserve within them the layered narratives of a growing urban center and the complexities of South Indian resistance to British expansion.A highlight of the walk is the iconic Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace a rare example of Indo-Islamic architecture with its intricate wooden pillars frescoes and elegant symmetry. Once the seat of royal administration and leisure the palace offers insights not only into architectural aesthetics but also into the socio-political life of the Sultanate in the 18th century.As we navigate the narrow lanes of Old Bengaluru one encounters a little-known but historically important site: a surviving armoury tucked into the urban sprawl and forgotten by modern maps. Used during Tipu’s reign this structure is a physical testament to the city’s martial past and the strategic importance of Bangalore in Mysore’s military planning.A focal point of this walk is the Battle of Bangalore (1791) a critical campaign during the Third Anglo-Mysore War. The battle pitted the British East India Company against Tipu Sultan’s forces and highlighted not only the military prowess of the Sultanate but also broader geopolitical shifts—especially the fallout of British actions in other global theatres such as in the American Revolutionary War.It is particularly notable that the Mysorean rockets used innovatively during this time caught the attention of British military observers. Some of these designs later found their way into documentation that would influence the development of European—and even American—military technology. Legend holds that they partly inspired Francis Scott Key’s reference to "the rockets' red glare" in the Star-Spangled Banner.Finally the walk concludes with a return to the present—by way of South Indian culinary tradition offering participants a curated local snack and a cup of filter coffee. A reminder that history does not only reside in books or ruins—it lives on in tastes traditions and memories.This walking tour is not just about stones and structures. It is a curated window into Bengaluru’s transformation—from fortified stronghold and seat of regional power to colonial outpost and finally to modern metropolis. In walking its paths we do not merely observe history; we retrace it.Note : "This walk is led by a Bengaluru native and professional architect who has lived and studied in the vicinity of the fort for over three decades. His deep-rooted connection to the area combined with his architectural expertise gives him an intimate knowledge of not just every corner of the fort but also the rich history that surrounds it."

name: Madhuragati: An Odissi Dance Performance
description: Madhuragati - Every step in Odissi resounds with the sweetness of a cultural aesthetic formed over centuries of aspiration for a higher goal.. To celebrate the beauty of this exquisite dance form arising from the life and beliefs of the people of forgone times till now. Anoushka will perform dance works that showcase a range of possibilities highlighting the sculptural and expressive qualities of the Odissi style.The performance features pieces that are seamlessly connected by brief introductory interludes. This carefully crafted format offers an engaging experience for the audience, guiding them through the beauty of the Odissi classical dance form. Originally a sacred ritual dedicated to the gods, Odissi is one of the oldest dance traditions in the world. Odissi speaks of love and union, between the human and divine, transporting viewers to enchanted worlds of magic and spirituality. Its sensuous and lyrical grace reflects both the motifs of Odisha temple sculpture as well as the poetry from the deep wellsprings of Odia music.Anoushka Rahman, disciple of Guru Surupa Sen, is the new soloist and emerging star of The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.She started her Odissi journey with Smt.Dona Ganguly in Kolkata and holds a Sangeet Bhaskar in Odissi dance and a postgraduate degree in Mathematics.Her association with Nrityagram began in 2018 through a Summer Workshop, which paved the way for advanced training under the guidance of Surupa Sen and Pavithra Reddy. Recognised for her talent and dedication, she was awarded the Virendra Kumar Laroia Fellowship. She has performed with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble across India, the US, Canada and Sri Lanka and was presented in a solo debut performance in November 2024. At present, Anoushka is a dancer with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.ChoreographyGuru Kelucharan Mohapatra (Sun Maiyyā)Surupa SenMusic CompositionPt. Raghunath PanigrahiAshit Desai (Sun Maiyyā)Technical Director & Lighting DesignerLynne FernandezNrityagramwww.nrityagram.orglynne@nrityagram.orgVenue: SABHA Blr, 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042

name: Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle: Book Launch
description: In an era where Gen Zs and millennials seek meaning through experiences rather than possessions, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle – Stories of Friendships & Adventures in Nature offers exactly the kind of soulful escape today’s young adventurers crave. For those who live for spontaneous road trips, mountain treks, beach escapades, and serendipitous conversations with strangers—and secretly nurture the hope of finding love and companionship along the way—Priyanka Kumar’s latest collection is a deeply relatable read. With its mix of short stories and memoir-style reflections, this book resonates with those who believe that real connection and personal discovery often happen far away from the familiar.The newest installment in Priyanka’s celebrated People’s Kafe series, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle brings together heartfelt stories and travel-infused memories that capture the healing magic of nature and the unspoken bonds we form with people and places. Though it’s not a travelogue in the conventional sense, the book reads like one—with vivid glimpses into landscapes and emotions that stay with the reader long after they turn the final page.And yet, the book is as much about the people as it is about the places. There are tales of peacocks who roamed her childhood garden like kin, strangers-turned-friends on spontaneous journeys, and even encounters that subtly hint at love blossoming when least expected. The presence of love—gentle, unforced, and organic—is a quiet undercurrent in a couple of these stories, offering a warm, relatable thread for every romantic dreamer who has ever looked out of a train window and wondered, what if?

name: Around the World in 8 Ragas
description: Across continents and centuries, humanity has carried one universal companion: Music. From desert caravans tracing ancient trade routes, to sailors navigating uncharted seas, to pilgrims and warriors moving across borders, cultures have exchanged not only goods and beliefs—but also sound. “Around the world in 8 Ragas” is a concert that explores how musical scales, though born in different corners of the globe, reveal a shared human instinct for expression.Follow the journeys of iconic scales—Pentatonic, Raga, Maqam, Modes, and more. We uncover how these musical structures spread through Silk Road markets, African diaspora rhythms, medieval monasteries, and colonial crossroads. We invite audiences to listen to history, one Raga at a time.Performers :Ashwin Baliga, Vocals (US-Based Indian Classical vocalist, student of Mahesh Kale and Pt. Milind Chittal, creator of the world's first Raga Bath)Shadaj Godkhindi, Flute (Acclaimed flutist and student of renowned maestro Pt. Pravin Godkhindi)Amit Kavthekar, Tabla (Multi-Genre collaborator and prodigious disciple of Ustad Allah Rakha and Ustad Zakir Hussain)Vivek Santosh, Keys (Trinity-trained Classical pianist with a Masters in Carnatic Music)

name: The Store Of Life: Book Reading Session by Shruthi
description: At the supermarket, you fill your basket to get the most for your money. At the Store of Life, you fill your basket to get the most out of your time, the one truly finite resource.At this book-reading session, we’ll explore a few chapters together, try out some simple activities, and reflect on what we choose to carry with us. As you spend your most important currency, your time, with me, I hope to fill your life basket with a little bit of joy, clarity, and purpose.This event is free of charge, but it is “charged” in that precious currency of time.Whether you're struggling to say no, trying to find balance, hoping to create space for what matters, or curious about the compounding power of small habits, there’s something here for you.Told through simple doodles and gentle reflections, the book invites you to pause, pick wisely, and carry only what brings joy, peace, and purpose. You can flip through it lightly, dip into it occasionally, or explore it deeply - whatever your heart desires.So… what will you choose to carry with you?And if you can, do join the session. It would fill my basket with joy.

name: Earthlore: The Indigenous Music Band
description: Earthlore Band is a one-of-a-kind musical collective from India that blends indigenous heritage with contemporary soundscapes. Rooted in the traditions of communities such as the Jenu Kuruba and Paniya tribes of Karnataka and Kerala, the band features tribal artists who completed an intensive nine-month fellowship program with professional mentorship, supported by the Tata Trusts.Their music is a powerful expression of ancestral stories, rituals, and a timeless bond with nature — an authentic cultural experience brought to the stage.After a captivating performance in Kochi, Earthlore Band now arrives in Bengaluru.Come experience the magic of tribal music in your city!

description: UrbanGro Hydroponics 101​Curious about growing your own clean toxin-free food but don’t know where to start?​​Join us for a hands-on hydroponics workshop where you’ll learn everything you need to start your growing journey right from your balcony.​​🌱 What we’ll cover:​​Basics of hydroponics (what why how)​​Choosing the right system for your space​​Mixing nutrients for optimal plant growth​​Plant care maintenance & troubleshooting​​Live demo and hands-on participation​​🎁 Bonus:Each participant will go home with a hydroponic self-watering house plant to get started right away.​​💸 Fee: ₹800📅 Date: Saturday, Dec 13th🕒 Time: 3 PM – 6 PM📍 Location: Atlantis Sanctuary 👥 Limited Seats: Only 10 spots available!Only 2 wheeler parking available.Join @urbangronchain on Instagram and Twitter!

name: Eco Printing Workshop
description: Suitable for age 7 and aboveReconnect with nature through the mindful and magical art of Eco Printing. This hands-on workshop invites you to slow down, explore, and create using the natural pigments found in leaves, flowers, and plant materials around us.Join us for a hands-on Eco Printing Workshop where leaves, flowers, and natural pigments become your creative tools. Learn the magic of transferring botanical patterns onto fabric and create your own one-of-a-kind eco-printed tote bag to take home.During the session, you will:Learn the fundamentals of botanical printingUnderstand which plants yield the best colours and impressionsPrepare and treat fabrics using eco-friendly methodsExperiment with bundling, steaming, and imprint techniquesCreate your own eco-printed fabric tote bag to take homeWhether you are an artist, a craft enthusiast, an eco-lover, or simply curious, this workshop offers a grounding experience and a beautiful way to bring nature’s patterns into your everyday life.All materials will be provided - just bring yourself and your creative spirit.Join us for a soulful, sustainable, and inspiring afternoon. Book your ticket now!

name: CARBON II: A Solo Guitar Concert By Konarak Reddy
description: This very special solo guitar concert has been composed and curated by Konarak Reddy, to offer the audience a meditative and transportive experience.Konarak’s compositions for CARBON emerged from wondering about the frequencies of joy and consciousness, the romance of darkness and light. Memories of Isaac Albéniz’ Asturias. Chick Corea’s Spain and Bill Evans’ harmonic explorations in Blue in Green.Perhaps you might remember the lines “We are stardust, we are golden, billion year old carbon…" Or, Craig Santos Perez’s riff on Pablo Neruda’s Sonnet XVII “I love you like this because we'll only survive / in the nitrogen rich compost of our embrace, / so close that your emissions of carbon are mine, / so close that your sea rises with my heat.”Perhaps the darkness of carbon can awaken new mysteries for us."Felt blessed indeed for being privy to this ~ letting Kuki's music & musicality wash over us with such finesse & intricacy ~" - Parveen Sikand"Thank you Kuki for your generosity and magic. The songs were personal, you let us into your process of creation, into your mind and its glorious journeys. Still humming a couple of tunes." - Rajeev Ravindranathan"It was a magical and sublime experience. Love, creativity, and music flowed into the entire space and enveloped us."- Leenatha Reddy

name: Animal Flow with Vipin
description: What if movement wasn’t something you did, but something you felt?Animal Flow invites you into a different kind of practice, one that’s primal, grounded, and deeply intuitive. A system of fluid, quadrupedal movements that blend strength, mobility, rhythm, and control, it reconnects you with your body’s natural intelligence. No machines, no choreography, just pure, intentional motion.Led by Vipin Das, L2 Certified Animal Flow Instructor and Movement Coach, this immersive session will help you slow down, tune in, and move with both power and grace. Whether you’re into fitness, yoga, calisthenics, or simply curious, you’ll find a practice that’s equal parts challenging and grounding.Not a routine. Not repetition. Just you, your breath, and a body learning to move freely again.Imagine🐾 Primal movements that feel powerful, grounding, alive🌀 Slow transitions that build strength, mobility, and control🧘‍♂️ A mindful rhythm that pulls you out of your head and into your body🔥 A practice that leaves you centered, energised, and deeply awareWhat to expect? A 1.5-hour guided Animal Flow workshopFoundations, technique, and full-flow practicePersonal attention and mindful movement coachingA safe, supportive environment for all levelsWho is this for?Anyone curious about movement : beginners, fitness enthusiasts, yogis, dancers, athletes, or anyone wanting to reconnect with their body in a fresh, grounded way. No prior Animal Flow experience needed.

name: Personal Branding For Professionals - Online
description: About Event​An invite-only webinar for Founders, CXOs, HR Leaders & Professionals who want to become trusted voices in their industry.About the Webinar​In today’s digital-first world, your personal brand is more powerful than your CV.Whether you’re a Founder looking to attract opportunities, a CXO who wants to inspire trust, or an HR leader building culture, your online presence defines how people perceive you.In this exclusive webinar, you’ll learn how to:✅ Understand the core elements of a strong personal brand✅ Use LinkedIn & other social media channels to build authority✅ Attract clients, talent & opportunities through credibility✅ Apply a step-by-step framework to start building today​Who Should AttendFounders & Entrepreneurs​CXOs, VPs & DirectorsHR & People Leaders​Coaches, Consultants & Thought LeadersIf you’re serious about visibility, credibility, and influence, this is for you.​📅 Event DetailsDate: Saturday, 6th December 2025Time: 11:00 AM ISTCost: INR 1499/- + GST to be paid after approval​Platform: Google Meet (link to be shared after confirmation)Format: Interactive session + Live Q&A​🚀 How It WorksApply to Attend – Register via LumaShortlisting – Profiles reviewed via LinkedInRSVP & Confirm – Selected candidates get a payment linkAccess – On confirmation, receive the webinar link + resources​⚡ Why Limited Seats?This is private, focused, and interactive, not a mass webinar meant for everyone.Seats are limited to ensure real engagement & impact.​If you want to become a thought leader, attract opportunities, and build a strong community around your brand, this is your chance.​👉 Apply now to reserve your spot.Only 30 Seats | Invite-only.

name: Italian Fresh Pasta & Tiramisu Workshop
description: SPCECIAL OFFER: 2 TICKETS FOR LESS (at checkout)Date night/ family night: Come with a friend, partner or your kid and bond the Italian way. Or come solo and get paired with a new friend!Chef Natasha Celmi, who is trained and lived in Italy with her Southern Italian husband, is now in Bangalore at Canella Studio.Transport yourself to beautiful Italy in a cosy ambience of Italian music and food that is straight from an Italian home- fresh, flavourful and hits the spot! Upgrade your everyday with a masterclass in making fresh pasta dough. You’ll roll, shape and cook it to perfection, then knock up a delicious sauce for an undeniably satisfying bowlful. Aprons on!The menu is fresh hand rolled gnocchi (mini pasta pillows with a potato and flour dough) in the Chef's signature Italian pomodoro or pesto sauce and the most decadent grandma's secret tiramisu.What will you do:Make your own gnocchi dough from scratch, roll and shape the gnocchi and cook them.Demo by the chef of the two sauces- Italian tomato and pesto which you use later to toss your gnocchi in. Recipes will be shared for everything.Get to work making and layering your own mini tiramisu which you can take home to share with others...or enjoy it over dinner with your cooking mate.Sit down at the beautiful dinner tables at the studio to enjoy your pasta dinner while chatting with other guests and making new friends, or just bond with your date partner!Suitable for beginners and advance cooks- open to all!

description: _Do You Think You Know the City?_Step onto our unique floor projector for an immersive and competitive trivia experience that puts your Bengaluru knowledge to the test—its streets, stories, people, quirks, and hidden histories. Because knowing a city isn’t just about maps and landmarks; it’s about understanding the cultures, rhythms, and everyday moments that shape it.Play, compete, meet new people, and discover the city in unexpected ways—while getting to know not just Bengaluru, but the people who share it with you.The winner of Aata Aadi, Maja Maadi takes home 1,200 bonus points, fully redeemable at our merch shop. And everyone who plays doesn’t leave empty-handed — all participants receive goodies as a thank-you for bringing their Bengaluru spirit to the game.

name: The Winter Waltz
description: Step into The Winter Waltz, a beautifully curated masquerade evening unlike anything Bengaluru has experienced before. A night shaped by winter hues, hidden faces, warm candlelight, and the intimate rhythm of the waltz.This is not a party — it’s a ballroom night crafted for those who appreciate elegance, intention and meaningful connection. Expect a room full of rare, interesting people, each arriving behind a mask, each ready to meet the evening with curiosity.What makes it special:The last edition sparked a quiet cultural shift in the city — a return to old-world charm, intentional gatherings and experiences built around people, not crowds. The Winter Waltz continues that story, bringing together those who dare to show up with elegance, warmth and a touch of mystery.Limited seats. Invite only.Dress code: Evening bling attire. Refined, elegant, winter-toned. Tuxes, suits, corsets and gowns gala is the least we expect.

name: Mohlat
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

organizer.name: Mohlat
organizer.description: The world is loud, fast, and relentless. It rarely grants us a pause. But at Mohlat, we believe in stealing a moment from time itself.  Join us for "Mohlat-Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening of poetry, storytelling, and unfiltered expression.

name: Lecture 22: Fantastic Trees & Where We Find Them
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.We live in a city of gardens, rain trees, jacarandas, tabebuias, boulevards that purple in March and yellow in September, and lakes that may or may not actually be lakes anymore. A city where the seasons don’t just change, they bring in a colourful change. One month the streets are carpeted with pink trumpet petals, another month it feels like the entire city is exhaling gulmohars.We even start associating our favourite city spots with trees as icons. Like the giant Peepal tree that becomes the background for every Cubbon Reads pictures, or the beloved bookstore Champaca that almost seems suspended amongst the trees, or the boulevard when we go through on Old Airport Road.Which is why this edition of Pint of View is called Fantastic Trees and Where We Find Them. It is not going to be just a lecture for botany enthusiasts. It’s going to be your unofficial guide to recognising the giants we walk past every day.Ecologist Akshay Surendra will take you deep into the secret life of trees: how they are born, how they grow, how they have sex (yes, trees), how they die, and why some insist on growing everywhere while others play hard to get.Part storytelling, part pub quiz, part ode to Bangalore’s green soul, you’ll leave this session with a sharper eye, a calmer mind, and a sensory appreciation for the trees that have been quietly holding this city together long before we arrived. All this, over a complimentary drink and muffins at the gorgeous Lossfunk space in Indiranagar.🧠 What to Expect💭 A 45-minute talk that will introduce you to the fascinating lives of trees: how trees are born, how they grow, how they have sex, and how they die💬 15–20 minutes of Q&A to question, debate, and discuss🍹 A 30-minute mixer to connect with fellow curious minds🍺 One complimentary drink and muffins with your ticket✨ Conversations and one-on-one with the speaker post-talk📅 Event DetailsSunday, 14th December 2025 | 4 PM – 6 PM📍 Lossfunk, Indiranagar, Bangalore🎫 Limited to 90 attendees | Super early bird pricing for the first 10 tickets👤 About the SpeakerAkshay Surendra is an ecologist interested in how wild plants (and sometimes animals) interact with each other, and what those interactions mean for big questions around diversity, conservation and management of forests. He's had the good fortune to study trees and live amongst them in the rainforests of Sri Lanka, Andaman Islands and the Western Ghats. Akshay is currently a visiting faculty, Environmental Studies, at Ashoka University and holds a Ph.D. from Yale University.🍻 About Pint of ViewPint of View is inspired by the Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., and we’re bringing this format to India across major cities. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables and you leave with a drink in hand and a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday evening.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistsBishnupriya Chakrabarty is a Hindustani classical vocalist of the Kirana Gharana, known for her mellifluous voice and meditative style. A Gandabandh disciple of Pt. Biresh Roy (ITC SRA), she has also trained in Purab Ang under Vidushi Purnima Chowdhury, and continues her taalim with Vidushi Shubhra Guha and Pt. Channulal Mishra. A graded AIR artist, she has performed at major festivals including Saptak, India Habitat Centre, NCPA, and venues across Europe, Canada, and the US.She is accompanied by Deepak Marathe, a harmonium player trained under Pt. Rambhau Bijapure and Pt. Ram Narayan, known for his expressive, nuanced accompaniment.Terms and Conditions1. description: DRIP THEORY PRESENTS: HOMEGROUND SESSIONS - a Coffee Tasting & Brewing SalonNot another workshop — a slow, sensory afternoon built around rare coffee, good food, and easy conversations.At HomeGround Sessions, you’ll learn not just how to brew, but how to taste, smell, and read coffee through a guided cupping and hands-on brew practice, led by Arpan — Bangalore’s favourite coffee whisperer & Bhavnish, Founder, Genetics Coffee.We’ll explore how aroma, acidity, body, and finish come together to shape what’s in your cup — then bring it all alive with food pairings designed to enhance flavour.And because it’s Drip Theory, it’s never just about coffee — our vinyl bar and reading corner will be open all afternoon for you to unwind, sip, and stay awhile.☕ Your All-Inclusive Sensory Pass Includes:Station 1 -  Aroma & Taste Calibration — experience how different pairings (citrus, cacao, cheese) influence perceptionStation 2 - Guided Coffee Cupping — learn the global tasting ritual used by roasters and baristasStation 3 - On Terrace - Brew Practice Session — hands-on brewing with expert guidance and equipmentFlavourful Food Pairings in Snacks, Main Course — Access to Vinyl Bar + Reading Lounge — unwind, listen, and connectTake-Home Surprise from Drip Theory — a keepsake for your next brew📍 Indiranagar (exact location reveal after booking)🗓️14th December, Sunday⏰12-4pmEarlybird Starts at 1599Limited seats · Book your spot now — slow afternoons like these don’t happen often.

name: The Story Feast
description: The Story FeastEach chapter of Story Feast explores a different cuisine bringing flavours and dishes from across the world. It’s an intimate house-dinner experience where 10–15 people gather. Conversations are curated by Human Library Bengaluru while dinner (Veg.)(Non Dairy products) is lovingly curated by Chef Reva Almeida.Our Hosts:Chef Reva Almeida (Chef at Copper Cloves)Sahil Deshmukh (Founder of Human Library)Note: Story Feast is not a matchmaking platform.Event Flow1.Warm introductions with the hosts and attendees.2.Attendees are divided into smaller groups.3.Each group receives a bowl of prompts.4.Prompts are designed in three levels: Level 1 Level 2 and Level 3.Level 1 prompts help people ease in.Example: What is your earliest childhood memory?Level 2 prompts encourage deeper conversations.Example: What is one habit from your lifestyle you’d recommend to others?Level 3 prompts bring out reflections and shared meaning.The format allows everyone to feel comfortable with both the experience and the stranger sitting across from them.Afterwards we gather for dinner where Chef Reva shares the stories behind each dish.

name: Mahabharat Quest: Mythological Walks at Lalbagh
description: ✨ What if the Mahabharat came alive through the trees, rocks, & lake of Lalbagh?We wanted to bring the new away to help you experience the Epic that shapes much of India’s cultural imagination.We’ll explore stories and symbols from the saga associated with specific trees, rocks, lakes, and sculptures in the Garden, tracing how they appear in the narrative tradition across Vyas’ magnum opus (be it BORI Critical Edition, Gita Press & KM Ganguli’s first English translation) and regional works (like Sarala Mahābhārata, Pampa Mahabhārata) to folk traditions (like Bhil Bharata) along with exploring backstories in Puranic lore while considering medieval to modern retellings. We will end with a fun group activity that will help you understand the structure of the Epic and how text communicates with us.Whether you’ve joined our flagship walks (🔴 North, 🟢 West, 🔵 Main Gate) or themed walks like 🟣 Ramayan Quest — OR this will be your first time at the Garden (or with the Epic) — there’s something both familiar and new for everyone in this never-done-before 🟠 Mahabharat Quest.What is guaranteed is your relationship with the saga, and the space will change forever!🏙️ Afternoon Walk — 20 Dec (Sat) ⏰ 3–4:30 PM (1.5 hours)🌅 Morning Walk — 21 Dec (Sun) ⏰ 7:30–9 AM (1.5 hours)👣 Slow-paced along a shaded path (~1.5 km) for all (10+ years and above), with plenty of resting spots for immersive storytelling.📝 Limited slots with time-based offers, so book early!ABOUT THE PROJECT:Before & Beyond History is an initiative under Mythematical, Prihistorica & Cosmonomic — curated and hosted by Anupriy Kanti & Rohina Thapar — that offers in-person experiences blending mythology, prehistory, and astronomy.

name: Ramayan Quest: Mythological Walks at Lalbagh
description: ✨ Ever wondered what it feels like to walk through moments of the Ramayan — not just read about it?We wanted to bring the new away to help you experience the Epic that shapes much of India’s cultural imagination.Before & Beyond History invites you to a first-of-its-kind themed storytelling walk through Lalbagh Botanical Gardens, where the trees, rocks, and flowers of Bengaluru’s favourite Garden become mediums to one of the world’s greatest epics.Join your hosts, Anupriy and Rohina, as they guide you through this mythological walk that not only tells but also traces how stories and symbols from the Epic evolved across the Valmīki Sanskrit Ramayan (be it BORI Critical Edition or Gita Press), regional retellings like Tulsidas’ Ramcharitmanas, Kamba Ramavataram, Krittivasi Ramayan, and explores backstories in Puranic lore while considering medieval to modern retellings. We will conclude with a fun group activity that will help you understand how the narrative tradition evolves.Whether you’ve joined our flagship walks (🔴 North, 🟢 West, 🔵 Main Gate) or themed walks like 🟠 Mahabharat Quest — OR this will be your first time at the Garden (or with the Epic) — there’s something both familiar and new for everyone in the 🟣 Ramayan Quest.What is guaranteed is your relationship with the saga, and the space will change forever!🌅 Morning Walk — 20 Dec (Sat) ⏰ 7:30–9 AM (1.5 hours)🏙️ Afternoon Walk — 21 Dec (Sun) ⏰ 3–4:30 PM (1.5 hours)👣 Slow-paced along a shaded path (~1.5 km) for all (10+ years and above), with plenty of resting spots for immersive storytelling.📝 Limited slots with time-based offers, so book early!ABOUT THE PROJECT:Before & Beyond History is an initiative under Mythematical, Prihistorica & Cosmonomic — curated and hosted by Anupriy Kanti & Rohina Thapar — that offers in-person experiences blending mythology, prehistory, and astronomy.

name: Four Voices, One Celebration: Book Launch
description: Join us for a morning of inspiration, healing, and heartfelt storytelling as Inner Healing Oasis Publishing proudly presents the launch of four remarkable books — each offering a unique perspective on growth, resilience, and the human journey.On 20th December 2025, from 11:00 AM to 1:30 PM, the iconic Atta Galatta Bookstore in Bengaluru will host this special gathering — uniting four diverse authors whose words resonate with truth, transformation, and hope.Meet the Authors and Their BooksI’m a Fresher, I’m Confused by Zahed Ali A witty, heartfelt story that captures the struggles and aspirations of a young man stepping out of college and into the fast-paced world of the IT industry. Honest and humorous, it reflects the confusion, courage, and self-discovery of a generation finding its way.Heal with Melody by Shweta Saimy A soulful guide to using sound, rhythm, and vibration as pathways to healing. Through the language of music and emotion, this book helps readers reconnect with inner harmony and find balance through self-expression.Her Second Spring by Dr. Sameer Paranjape A compassionate and empowering book that brings to light the emotional, physical, and social experiences of women navigating menopause. It is a celebration of the strength, wisdom, and renewal that mark a woman’s “second spring” in life.Rewriting Destiny by Sanjib Chowdhury A transformative exploration of quantum healing and human consciousness. Sanjib blends science and spirituality to reveal how we can transcend limiting beliefs and consciously shape our destiny.An Event to Inspire and ConnectThis multi-author launch is more than a literary gathering — it’s a celebration of stories that heal, empower, and ignite conversation. Meet the authors, listen to their journeys, experience live readings, and be part of a morning that celebrates creativity, courage, and community.We are also honored to have industry experts from relevant fields gracing the event with their presence — adding depth, dialogue, and fresh perspectives to the conversation.Come witness the moment where ink meets energy, and stories come alive.Venue: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indiranagar, BengaluruDate: 20th December 2025Time: 11:00 AM – 1:30 PMHosted by: Inner Healing Oasis (IHO)
